The Paris district where Parisians are priced out
subhead: In 50 years, the 8th arrondissement of the French capital, home to the Champs-Elysées and the 'Golden Triangle,' has lost nearly half its population. The mass acquisition of real estate by ultra-wealthy foreigners has driven locals out.

Emmys 2025: 'The Studio' makes history, 'Adolescence' and 'The Pitt' take top prizes
subhead: 'The Studio' broke the record of 11 Emmys for a comedy in a season, set by 'The Bear' in 2024. Every acting winner other than Jean Smart for 'Hacks' was a first timer.

title: The US-Israeli war against Gaza
subhead: The United States' fierce campaign against international justice is an implicit admission of its complicity in the crimes committed by Israel in the Gaza Strip, historian Jean-Pierre Filiu argues in his column.

title: 'Not a job, but a love story': Morocco's racing pigeon craze
subhead: Unlike Europe, where the number of breeders is declining, Moroccans are embracing pigeon racing with enthusiasm. In Casablanca, more than 1,000 fanciers are concerned about rising temperatures that threaten their birds.

title: Putin's party prevails in Russian elections even without campaigning
subhead: Local elections were held across Russia on September 12 and 14. The campaign was particularly dull in Kostroma, a tourist town northeast of Moscow, revealing a society stifled by repression and overcome by apathy and weariness.

title: Israeli intelligence admits Iran's nuclear program has not been destroyed
subhead: Israeli officials have recently provided French authorities with their own assessment of the airstrikes that targeted Tehran's nuclear arsenal in June. This information is particularly valuable to France after American intelligence agencies have halted all cooperation with their European partners regarding the Iranian nuclear program.

title: France's best art exhibitions this fall, in Paris and beyond
